text: So for chief investment officer, the way I think of it is I hold myself responsible for all investment related activities at the firm. Research is essentially it drives the principles for how you're going to invest. So you do all the research. You say, OK, here's the things that we're going to use to select stocks. Here's how we're going to organize those themes into a portfolio. How concentrated is it? And then there's a part about taking that investment model. So at the end of the day, what you wind up with is a model saying this is the best way we think the best expression of how you can go about investing. We then hand that over to portfolio management that takes that model, takes every client's holdings and translates that into trade. So there's a part about then executing on that. And that's where portfolio management and trading come through. And then there is a technology layer that supports that. So the way that I think about separating is that research is kind of the upfront work that sits there and establishes the principles. Portfolio management and trading are basically executing on those supported by technology. And for me, the way that we've organized the team is I have incredibly strong leads and heads of portfolios. Portfolio management, trading and technology. So I get to focus on research, which is really kind of the passion of mine anyways, which is trying to figure out how the stock market works.

segments.text: So for chief investment officer, the way I think of it is I hold myself responsible for all investment related activities at the firm.
Research is essentially it drives the principles for how you're going to invest.
So you do all the research. You say, OK, here's the things that we're going to use to select stocks.
Here's how we're going to organize those themes into a portfolio. How concentrated is it?
And then there's a part about taking that investment model.
So at the end of the day, what you wind up with is a model saying this is the best way we think the best expression of how you can go about investing.
We then hand that over to portfolio management that takes that model, takes every client's holdings and translates that into trade.
So there's a part about then executing on that. And that's where portfolio management and trading come through.
And then there is a technology layer that supports that.
So the way that I think about separating is that research is kind of the upfront work that sits there and establishes the principles.
Portfolio management and trading are basically executing on those supported by technology.
And for me, the way that we've organized the team is I have incredibly strong leads and heads of portfolios.
So I get to focus on research, which is really kind of the passion of mine anyways, which is trying to figure out how the stock market works.
